website_summaries.verdict: This modern-looking tank is durable and a great upgrade for a betta tank.
pros: Nice lines and a pleasing design
cons: At 2.6 gal., this aquarium will not be healthy for more than one fish

website_summaries.verdict: A bigger and more modern-looking betta tank that works well in your home or office.
pros: Glass tank comes as a kit for a quick set up
Good size for one betta to thrive
Nice design with the filter built into the back of the tank
Brightness on the light is good
Adjustable flow on the current of the pump allows you to make the environment comfortable for your fish
cons: This does not come with a heater
While many betta environments do not need a heater, if you find you need one, you will have to buy it separate

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: The tank does not filter properly at all.. all I ever see is anything on the waters surface circling the tank and never going to the filtration port. It's causing serious issued with my water quality. I will be buying a different tank since this on is Terrible!!! Local fish stores say the same thing about this tank when I went to ask for advice on how to fix my problems. EVERY single one said it's the tank...
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this tank
customer_reviews.text: The filtration system to too strong. You have to plug up the intake to slow things down or your fish are constantly running a never ending marathon. This is not a tank for a betta or any fish that doesn't normally live in a fast flowing stream. Even then, they NEVER get a rest. The LED lights are BRIGHT, really BRIGHT! My advice, find a different tank.
customer_reviews.author: E. Henley

customer_reviews.title: Death trap for small fish and Snail.
customer_reviews.text: If you have small fish or snails, this tank might kill them. The first day, my small golfish was caught in a little intake hole on the back wall. I pulled him out, fully expecting him to be in half or dead. He survived, but was dented. The worse was my poot snail that we got because the tank began to grow algae rapidly. He got stuck, died and the fish ate him. It has been a truly glorious experience for my fish. Are small fish tanks with filters supposed to grow algae so quickly??? The videos that I have watched about cleaning the tank, make you wish you had never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia O.

customer_reviews.title: I received it today and absolutely love it. It is a contemporary cool looking fish ...
customer_reviews.text: I received it today and absolutely love it. It is a contemporary cool looking fish tank. As other recommended i put heater at the back of the chamber and everything works well. I am just waiting for the water temp to go up then one of my fish will have new home. I am thinking to buy 12 gallon tank for the other one so he can have tankmates like neon tetra, ghost shrimp and some snail?
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: LED light thumbs down!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a year ago and I everything was fine. Until about 4-5 months in, the screaming LED light causes a major algae bloom in my tank. It got so bad that it actually grew on my snails shell and my anubias plant and basically everything. Yes, I did minimize the use of light but everytime I turn it back on... BAM!... all over again. So I ended up getting natural light for it. Other then that, everything else is fine. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: J. I.

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love this tank. It’s great for the beginning aquarium enthusiast. The pros are that the tank is very nice and the filter system is excellent especially for a tank that size. It broke in easily and within 48 hours I feel the tank was ready to home a betta. The cons are that the light is really not powerful enough to grow many aquatic plants. I’m going to buy an aftermarket light to replace it. For the price, it’s a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: kristopher q.

customer_reviews.title: There is No Better!
customer_reviews.text: This is my s second Fluval tank. This one is smaller and home for two goldfish I inherited from my adult daughter. These tanks are always very quite, require very little maintenance, etc. My bigger tank has a balance of plants, shrimp, and two bottom dwellers. This balance makes keeping everybody healthy and happy! BTW... I am not exaggerating... It came triple-boxed, and arrived quickly and in perfect shape!
customer_reviews.author: cesar perez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tank!
customer_reviews.text: The tank looks great! The filter it came with didn't do much to keep the tank clean at all...and the small crevices on the back wall can be tricky to clean. However, I went out and bought a water filter separately at a pet store and it changes the game! The light on top is a tap to turn on/off and the accuracy is a bit off, I sometimes have to tap 5-6 times before it works. But there are 2 light settings. The bright light setting is BRIGHT, great for plants and the darker purple light is definitely cute. I slipped a heater in the back right section and warms to tank without taking space away from our Betta.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set up for planted shrimp tank
customer_reviews.text: Shrimp planted tank. Love most things about this! Light is bright and pump seems to be the right level of flow. It is very quiet. The lower intake can trap little shrimp so I use a credit card to block. I also blocked the upper intake with some filter floss. It is pretty hard to trim my Monte Carlo with the light in place, not sure how to fix that issue. Overall would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and functional for awhile but leaky after 13 months.
customer_reviews.text: 13 months into ownership of the Fluval Spec III and it has sprung a leak. I never moved it from the original location of setup, never even picked it up, never caused any trauma to it, checked it with a level and it isn't on an uneven surface....and yet it is leaking from the bottom about 1/16th of its 2.6 capacity daily. I will be contacting the makers to determine if it will be replaced under warranty. Until the point it sprung a leak, I was mostly happy with it and would have given it 4 or 5 stars. All other components have been in working order and have caused me no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a betta
customer_reviews.text: I like this. Modern, stylish, bright LED lights, and hidden cords/filtration. You have to modify it a bit for a betta. I turned the suction down to its lowest setting and then stuffed the output with some sponge material to dissipate the flow. By doing this, your betta won't be tossed around, leading to less stress. I got the white one. It really is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Malik

customer_reviews.title: My favorite nano tank
customer_reviews.text: I love these tanks! I think they are perfect for a betta. (I know some would disagree...) the filtration system is good, although I toss the carbon and use purigen. The new stock light grows low light plants beautifully. I've also used it for small shrimp colonies. If you're looking for a first tank this is a great one to start with, since everything is included (except a heater) and setup is easy.
customer_reviews.author: TriLei

customer_reviews.title: Great tank overall
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I would have a dozen if I had space for them. We kept a koi beta/Otocinclus/Amano shrimp in it for awhile and then changed it over to only cherry shrimp. It runs quietly and is easy to maintain and clean. We have several larger tanks (125, 65, and 45) so we are considered purchasing another one of these to use as a quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Betta (with an adjustment)
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tank for our betta. Went ahead and purchased the valve to adjust the water supply. If you are considering this tank for a betta, go ahead and just purchase it with the tank ( Just had to cut out some tubing and add it to the tubing. Really was pretty simple and easy to set up. Also went ahead and purchased the 25W heater to keep the temperature warm enough for the tank ( It fits really well b/c it is thin and easy to set up in the tank. Super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Filter
customer_reviews.text: After going through so many cheap & crappy tanks, I've found the one! This tank is so beautiful and modern looking, and I'm sure its bigger than 2.6 gallons because I filled it up with gallon jugs and it took almost 4 to fill. The filter is AMAZING. Super quiet. The only thing about the filter I don't like is the filter power. It's a bit strong for a betta, so I poked 2 small holes in the clear tube to diffuse the flow. I love this tank and my betta in it! PS - The first time I ordered this I received is shattered, so the packaging and delivery people should be fragile with the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up despite skimpy instructions
customer_reviews.text: Received it today and although the instructions are skimpy, set up was easy and uneventful. I haven't yet observed reliability or durability but it set up quickly and was paying free and my fish is enjoying his environment for the time being at least. I'll update this review if necessary. this unit was small enough to fit on a corner of my very small computer desk and ads to my ability to stay calm. Update 2 months later: VERY HAPPY WITH IT
customer_reviews.author: Sanford S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking tank. The only down fall is the filter is a little too strong for my Betta. But an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Set it up as a pico saltwater reef tank
customer_reviews.text: Great little all in one unit, best suited for freshwater unless you want to upgrade lighting like I did, to support saltwater use. Would be perfect for a betta tank, or a small shrimp tank. Holds 2.5 gallons, attractive and includes LED light. Very happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: C. McNamee

customer_reviews.title: Fluval is a good brand.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Fluval products for the last 20 years when I ran the aquarium dept at a small zoo. So when I went to get my first personal fish tank (I'm over having a large collection to take care of) I knew I wanted one with a built in sump. Although the design of the light is different than the one pictured, the tank is great.
customer_reviews.author: Colchicine

customer_reviews.title: I was so surprised how nice this tank actually is
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised how nice this tank actually is! I bought it based on reviews and I'm happy to give it a five star rating. The tank has amazing clarity, literally from every angle. The filter is one of the most quiet I have ever experienced! It's perfect for out new little betta fish "Apple".
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: WORST PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many tanks/brands and this is by far the worst! The filter is crap. The filter isn't strong enough to keep the tank clean for more than 4-5 days at a time. The current is too strong for a betta. Not only do I have to modify the flow, even when at its lowest setting, but I also have to modify the slits so my betta's fins don't get torn up. What a disaster. ZERO STARS. And, a waste of my money. This cheap looking plastic junk will be trashed tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: RemyJax

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Betta!
customer_reviews.text: We got this tank to replace a 2 gallon fish bowl. Perfect for our fish, Nigel 2.0. My only concerns are if you have cats, def keep out reach with opening in the top. Also, we have to turn the pump off when we feel Nigel 2.0 because the filter sucks up his food pretty quickly. Other than that, easy to assemble and beautiful! Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Best mini tank out of 3 tries!
customer_reviews.text: After a very bad experience with 2 petsmart tanks, we finally spent the money for a solid performance with Fluval. The powerhead is definitely a huge step up in quality along with this awesome LED light great for plants and more. Tank is also well built with nicely engineered sump in the back. Best mini tank EVER!
customer_reviews.author: WebersMN

customer_reviews.title: Good for Small Fish and Shrimp
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a desk if you have a small betta, snails, or shrimp. I would decibel not recommend sticking anything else or more than that. Light is great and you can keep live plants with it. Quiet filter, a little strong, but with some in front of it the flow doesn't bother my fish. Great little tank.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Updated to disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just about perfect. Only issue is the plastic that surrounds the bottom. They could have done better, it feels flimsy and could easily break and not to mention it’s a killer on your hands once there’s weight to tank. *update This tank is awful, the pump constantly stops working and the water becomes stagnant. Wouldn’t recommend this over priced tank.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, efficient filtration in a sleek-looking tank
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for almost 3 years and it’s still going strong. Looks sleek and water stays clean thanks to the filtration system. Easy to clean, lid, motor, light can all can come off so that every part of the tank can be gently sponged clean. Fluval makes the quietest motors - you can’t hear anything with this one, and I’ve seen the 5-gallon Fluval Chi at work too, and the are both extremely quiet.
customer_reviews.author: New Cambridge Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good tank but a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice tank but a couple complaints. First, the power adapter for the light makes a VERY loud buzzing sound. Unbearable. It can be heard from another room. I'm almost positive it is broken/damaged so I'm going to contact the company to get another one. I'm not going to repack and send the aquarium back to amazon so hopefully this works out. Also, the filter outlet hole is very close to the top of the tank so that makes moving the tank very difficult because the water level is so close to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F

customer_reviews.title: Good fish tank
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, good size, glass, simple sleek design. I have a betta in it, he seems to be ok with it. The pump isnt noisy but I dont keep it on all the time because he doesnt like the stream from it.
customer_reviews.author: PP81

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank
customer_reviews.text: I was super worried about the tank arriving shattered but it was packaged really really well- both in the fluval box and the shipping box. It’s a beautiful tank and I love the built in filtration (and that you can hide a heater back there too.) My only issue is that the output is crazy strong even on the lowest setting, so you need some type of baffle if you’re putting a betta in there. The light is also crazy bright and it’d be nice if there were a dimmer option, but the blue light was a nice surprise!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Quiet. Easy to set up. Looks good. Fits perfectly in a Better Homes and Gardens storage cube organizer. Only complaint is that the light seems a little overbearingly bright when set to full brightness. My fish doesn't swim to the top of the tank unless it's off (even when fed). Luckily there are 3 brightness settings: Low (blue lights), High (blue & white lights) and Off. There is a circular touchpad on top of the light that I initially missed. Seems to be quiet enough for an office or workspace. So far I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Does not come with any rocks or decorative accents - just the tank and filter system, lid and light. It looks great! Perfect size to house a beta. Noticed that because the filter system is enclosed in the glass, that the running filter also seems to warm the water. Very happy with this purchase, and so is the fish!
customer_reviews.author: CLesterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get. Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great little powerhouse aquarium we use for plants, shrimp and snails. Worth the money so far. Real quiet but we purchased an additional lamp. Best little tank I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: A Powers

customer_reviews.title: The bottom came broken!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of my tank came broken. The base on which the tank stood was loose on one side. So on one side, the aquarium just fell through. (See attached video if you want to see the loose base.) It looks like the glue came undone and the tank just fell through. I feel like this tank is not very high quality if the base and the tank are held together by glue that can fall apart so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Great size, value and filter costs
customer_reviews.text: This tank is the nicest you will find for size, price. The only complaint I have -the pump compartment is so narrow and deep...you have to be creative how to get in there sometimes. Not a deal breaker but a hassle. My betta loves it. The output is strong no matter what setting you use. A piece of filter media stuck on the flow out put nozzle slows the current for the fish. Otherwise the poor guy would be exhausted and stressed fighting that current.
customer_reviews.author: GreenEyedHollie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful light, elegant decor.
customer_reviews.text: We He purchased his tank to get our. ETA “Viking” more swimming room; we liked the assembly, filterand pump are quiet, tank itself is beautiful and the lights are amazing. The only drawback is, as many others have suggested/mentioned, is the filter and it’s lack of djustment control outside the tank and the pressure regulator. Even the lowest setting it is quite strong however, it took my Beta about a day to get used to it. Now he is loving it! Assembling the filter took some work but it fits nicely. We are more than happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazone Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tank for a Betta in the office
customer_reviews.text: This tank is the perfect combo of size and efficiency and has everything but a heater (which not everyone needs). Bought a small heater which fits perfectly in the back slot with the air pump. Some people seem worried about the air flow being too much but it's perfect and my Betta is very happy with his tank upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Annielikeslyrics

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank.
customer_reviews.text: My oldest has this tank in her room. Now her younger sister wants one too, so I ordered the same one. The new one did come with the upgraded light. You can't go wrong with this setup, especially with the amazon price. Easy to clean and maintain. A small heater to the pump compartment is my only modification.
customer_reviews.author: 80Grady

customer_reviews.title: ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I had a different line and the light broke so I bought this one, this one the light is very very very extremely bright too bright. It doesn’t filter out the water correctly. I seen bad reviews but I bought it anyway not overly happy with it
customer_reviews.author: JojoOddo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these tanks i had to buy 2 after my topfin betta flow relax tank broke! They are the same proce as these. And this tNk is soo quiet i dont even know they are on! I have live plant in them soo i only do water changes every 3 weeks because of the over size filtration. They are very pretty. The lighting is great! My bettas are sooo happy. I motiffied the filter flow by poking a couple small holes in the tube so there is a low flow. They are great tanks 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: No bad
customer_reviews.text: Cute aquarium. I didn’t like the filter, not enough circulation in the tank so I bought another one. I wish the light wasn’t as bright.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Raine Cline

customer_reviews.title: Love this tank!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter received it as a Christmas gift. We all love it! It’s stylish, quiet and is perfect for her fish. The two light settings can serve as a nightlight too!
customer_reviews.author: T&B

customer_reviews.title: Love this tank
customer_reviews.text: I love this fish tank. We keep it in our kitchen and it is the centerpiece of the room. The light still works great after several months. I change 25% of the water every 1-2 weeks and have had no problems with the tank. Hint: don't leave the light on more than 8 hours a day or you will get algae issues
customer_reviews.author: Christopher I.

customer_reviews.title: Good but flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. Filter could be better. Water splashes out of the cover so it has to be cleaned pretty frequently. Even had a fish jump out of the hole in the top once. If you have to plug anything in (heater, air stone) the lid doesn’t fit great so you have to poop everything through the hole in the top. It definitely has its flaws.
customer_reviews.author: CandyJW RN

customer_reviews.title: Love the filtration.
customer_reviews.text: This is great aquarium. Set it up 2 weeks ago and I am just about near the end of it cycling. Will be able to add fish shortly. Has a wonderful filtration system in the back, which allows nitribactor and nitrosamonus beneficial bacteria to grow quickly. Comes with a great sponge, and whatvyou need to get started. Great little aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Irving Baum

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great nano tank. This aquarium is close to silent, and the light is great for planted aquarium. Unlike cheaper aquarium kits, there's no need to upgrade the filter or light. The Spec is ready to rock upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: DanOlson27

customer_reviews.title: Love This Tank!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank! It was easy to set up and looks amazing! I turned the pump to its lowest setting and it's perfect for a betta! Not sure why other people made adjustments to their tanks.. I found no need for that. It's a great tank as is! You can also fit a heater in the back of the tank with the pump and it filters the warm water throughout the tank. The slats in the tank are small enough that my ADF's can't get in there or get stuck.. Which was a big plus for me. This tank is well made and very pleasing to the eye. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: MrClayShooter

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tank. If you put a betta in it, you’ll need to restrict the flow out of the filter. Even on low setting the flow is really strong. But fixable.
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. One for my son and one for me at work. Looks great and my fish are very happy. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: A perfect bedroom aquarium for a single fish
customer_reviews.text: After going through four (!) other aquariums, this is the one we settled on. Very high-quality materials used in the construction, and a perfect size for my daughter's bedroom. Currently there is one betta fish in it, and it's a good size for him. I reduced the flow from the pump using a piece of foam in the intake tub, which keeps the poor betta from being blown around the tank. We clean it as instructed, and have artificial plants inside. We may go with a live plant at some point, but for now it's pretty clean as long as we follow the instructions. Definitely, in my opinion, the best lower-priced home aquarium on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice tank at the end! Better that many others!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about fluval and that’s what made me really surprised when I saw this tank. 1- The water isn’t leveled in the tank! 2- There is extra rubber on the right corner! 3- The base bottom is very bad and makes it uncomfortable to carry! The tank looks great and I like it! I’m just expected more quality as always Fluval does!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking tank
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had the tank a couple days but so far so good. Set up was easy and it is a very nice looking little tank. Perfect for a planted betta tank. Some reviews claimed the pump output was too much. I turned it to the lowest setting and pointed the nozzle slightly upward and it doesn’t seem too strong. The intake isn’t extremely strong either. It didn’t even pull a small loose piece of java moss floating on top into the slits but did hold it against until it was water logged and sank. Any healthy fish should be easily able to avoid being sucked in.
customer_reviews.author: A. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to have received the newest model of this tank. I have the older version for my dwarf frog and absolutely love it. This one has been modified for my betta with the fluval sponge trick (just put it over the output). It's great!!! Perfect size for my desk. Looks beautiful. Nice revamped lighting. Very happy with this little tank; and so is Warren.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J.

customer_reviews.title: Bad filtering and Bad Heating!
customer_reviews.text: I had the awfullest time with this tank. It did not want to filter right and the water would always be dirty. I couldn't get the tank to heat properly either. I would not recommend this tank. The picture is not accurate either, I got a newer updated light and tank. Wish I had a picture of it to show, but I threw it away! Also, when I bought it the price was $49.99.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Functional Nano Aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: Love the built in sump, LOVE LOVE LOVE. The pump compartment is larger in the Spec III than in the Spec V, for some reason, making installation of a heater where it's hidden from the rest of the tank much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank, directions for setup could be a little more clear
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful glass aquarium, my betta loves his upgrade very much! My only reason for taking a star away is for how strong the filter system is. It works great, but it creates a pretty strong "current" in the tank. Also the directions were not very helpful with setting up the aquarium, I would've liked a little more details on how the pump was supposed to go because the pictures don't show the cord attached to it at all. Otherwise lovely tank!
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: good!
customer_reviews.text: Using it well so far, only minus is that the water level needs to be kept pretty high because of the filter, but you could probably cut out the plastic if you really wanted it to be lower. LED is nice, but I don't have any plants so can't tell if its strong enough for plants. It's bright enough to have a good look at how my fish is doing tho!
customer_reviews.author: Mira Kim

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Simple review- this tank is perfect. After my chi filter/light went I decided instead of possibly having another chi go- I’d try this. Absolutely love. It’s quiet and the two light options are awesome to have.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Leaky tank
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a grate tank aside from the fact it is leaking from the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Truehart

customer_reviews.title: Great small setup.
customer_reviews.text: Neat little tank. This is my first micro-tank. I've done salt water nano tanks for years with JBJ systems but decided to try something different. This has a pretty good setup for starters and glad it came with almost everything. It's also very quiet, I can hardly hear the tank and thanks to LED technology, I know power consumption is probably minimal. Will post more and update as things progress.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Py

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Nano Aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my daughters aquarium from a cheap 1.5 gal. The Flubal Spec 3 is simple to setup and work great the filter is amazing. Water is crystal clear. I would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Tee

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for a small desk tank
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a small desk tank, I wish the corner were black instead of silver. Filter is great, much better than marineland. There are different flow setting, but even put to low the filter is pretty strong.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A great tank aimed at keeping betta fish!
customer_reviews.text: These little tanks are a nice size for betta fish and maybe some snails. They really can’t house much else, so I do not recommend them for anything else. I use them for my male Bettas and have 3 of them set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... comes with almost all the gear required to keep happy fish. Heater and thermometer not included
customer_reviews.text: It comes with almost all the gear required to keep happy fish. Heater and thermometer not included. Filtration is in the back part of the tank which is great to keep the clutter out of the display portion of the tank. I use this tank to keep one Betta fish, one small shrimp, and live plants. The included LED lights work well for low-light plants. Betta's like little to low water current and the water pump supplied with tank is a tad too strong even in it's lowest setting. Easy to solve by placing a filter spong or something in front of the pump outlet to reduce the flow.
customer_reviews.author: K. lam

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: Really love the tank and style. Looks perfect. Love the large sponge filter with slots to add carbon and bio rings.
customer_reviews.author: hunterskeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tank- quiet filtration system.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tank so much, I bought another one. Perfect for my betta. So quiet and easy to clean. Lights are top notch. Filter is quiet enough for bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: orreo5859

customer_reviews.title: great looking
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet - my daughter just set it up in her room last night. it looks so nice! She picked out a couple of plants and cool natural stones for the bottom. next stop is pretty yellow guppy fish.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: So quiet I keep checking it to see if it is running!
customer_reviews.text: This tank is so pretty and it is so quiet - I keep checking to make sure the filter is on because it's so quiet. The light really makes it look beautiful, but it is bright and apparently I have that little known variety of goldfish known as the "vampire fish" who has not adjusted to the bright light yet. We are working up to having it on all day - right now it's a little bit at time. Great tank! I already ordered a second one for my son!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly - Charlotte, NC

customer_reviews.title: photos can not tell
customer_reviews.text: this aquarium is unbelievable gorgeous. you are going to want one for every room in your house. go to a fish store that sells live plants; 3-5 live plants is good, put in gravel that has Root Stimulator, like Carib-Sea. a couple of small fish to swim around the leaves, and you will feel instant calm. i bought the white one, and i would generally recommend this color; too long a discussion to say why.
customer_reviews.author: Snowman White

customer_reviews.title: Light shorted out
customer_reviews.text: The light was nice while it lasted. Shorted out after 4 months and it was almost never on...
customer_reviews.author: rangoon0337

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: Whisper quiet filter and very aesthetically pleasing! I am extremely happy with this purchase. It looks so good and the filter is high quality and I can’t even hear it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Watts

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed within three months
customer_reviews.text: The pump failed within three months. Emailed Fluval; no response. Tried calling; on hold forever. Called Amazon; they would only provide a $5 gift certificate. New pump costs $27--half the price of the tank.
customer_reviews.author: M7

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tank
customer_reviews.text: Great little tank. Seems well made, and comes with a nice light. A great all in one package. If using for betta, you need to cut a few holes in the outflow tube to reduce flow. And it also eliminates the stagnant water in that pocket. After the holes, it's a great spot for a hydor 25w heater. 0 complaints. My betta loves it
customer_reviews.author: zprince

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tank! Have had mine running for about 4 months now on my desk at work and couldn't be happier with it! Perfect size for shrimp or a couple of small fish. I did replace the included light with another one because I have a planted tank but that isn't a fault with this tank. Definitely happy that the light and filter have seperate plugs so that you can replace the light with a better one if you want to grow plants. Thinking about buying another one for my desk at home too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this for my betta fish
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this for my betta fish. I'm against keeping them in the tiny bowls, and this size was perfect. I actually ended up buying a second one because I liked the first so much. The white color is beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Kati Turner

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the spout pointing upward
customer_reviews.text: I was throughly happy about the product till it started leaking a bit 9 months later. I couldn't tell where the leakage was. Finally one day, I realized the the spout was pouring more water for a few seconds, causing the water to hit the lid and spilled over. Since then we turned the spout down even more.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Nice tank for limited counter space
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, compact, all-in-one aquarium for limited space situation. I did add a submersible heater to mine and the heater fits in the rear filter/pump compartment out of sight.
customer_reviews.author: George G

customer_reviews.title: Decoration advice for Spec III?
customer_reviews.text: Would some of you consider recommendations for decor? Obviously it needs to be limited. I’ll have one betta, and he will want private time. I wouldn’t mind knowing the exact setup from the production art on the box of the Spec III, doing that and perhaps adding small place for him to shelter. I’ll be dialing back the flow anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Great product for first time fish owners
customer_reviews.text: As an inexperienced fish owner I did a lot of research prior to making this purchase. I am happy to say that this product has been everything and more throughout the few months I've owned it. The filter system works great, the light is still going strong, and our betta is still very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality-Perfect for the office
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tank up and running for just over 3 months. No issues, currently housing a snail and a handful of cherry shrimp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After four months, the LED light strip shorted out ...
customer_reviews.text: After four months, the LED light strip shorted out (after normal use), and the replacement part is sold out at Fluval.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our needs
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my daughter's beta fish. Don't know how well the filter actually work, as the tank does seem to collect alge. But that could be another factor as this is our first foray into the aquarium game.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan K.

customer_reviews.title: A small tank that is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Looks really nice. Small. Good for 1 beta. Comes with filter and light. The light has two settings. Very quiet. Good for a first time fish owner.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: love it! just got it so I can get ...
customer_reviews.text: love it! just got it so I can get a betta and properly care for him. it's perfect for him and he seems to love it. it's super quiet and easy to install. she. I was getting fish I told the guy what tank I ordered (this one) and he told me it was a great choice that the company is awesome. I bought a heater as it doesn't come with one but that's okay. I just know that bettas like warmer temperatures. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: 👨🏻

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Great desktop aquarium, filtration system and lighting system work great. I've had this for a few months and only vacuum it monthly change 1\2 the water, and clean the foam filter. Wonderful low maintenance. I've now had the Tank for One year and it is still very low maintenance. I change the water every 6 months, and just add water as it evaporates.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Genius

customer_reviews.title: Great package
customer_reviews.text: Great package to get started just needed to add a heater for a Betta, a thermometer and some gravel and plants. Filter intake and outflow very light but could be a problem for some Bettas. Mine seems young and very active so no problem yet. Put a small piece of glass over the opening to prevent a suicide jump. Liking the two level LED lighting. Size is perfect for an office room. Interesting.. my betta like to lean against the intake flow to rest and sleep at night - seems to enjoy it but I'm keeping an eye on that for now. Took longer than expected for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Lou DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tanks
customer_reviews.text: I am a die hard marine fish collector. I decided to try out these little tanks. I normally keep hundreds of gallon tanks so this is a change for me. I really like them. Fluval should make a reliable heater for them that fits in with the streamlined design. I also think they should dual outlet the lights so you can run seperate timers. I cant see this costing them more then a couple dollars more to do. The fit and finish of these is great and cleaning them is easy. For $50 these cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great little betta tank
customer_reviews.text: Billy Betta had a small home at the pet store. So small his fins always hit the sides. I bought Billy and put him in this set up. The pump on lowest setting is perfect, just enough flow. Billy seems very happy now. Nice little tank.
customer_reviews.author: Fan of None

customer_reviews.title: It's a really sweet little unit
customer_reviews.text: It's a really sweet little unit. Very complete in features. My Betta is now is now 7 months old and will get a new 5 gallon tank for Christmas. It will be a Fluval.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner0

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Setup
customer_reviews.text: I have always had many large aquariums. I purchased this in white for my royal blue beta and a few dwarf frogs. The lights make for great ambiance. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: KEC

customer_reviews.title: For a small desk top aquarium I have loved it, My Betta seems very happy
customer_reviews.text: For a small desk top aquarium I have loved it, My Betta seems very happy. I have been able to adjust the filter down enough to keep the tank in great shape, but not cause too much water movement for the fish. This is a very clean elegant unit. Like all tanks, make sure you keep up with the cleaning so you fish stay healthy. My only wish for the tank, is that it had the blue LEDs as well as the white.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: Pump is noisey; possobly defective. Overall nice set up.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this tank running for about 72 hours now. The design is very sleek and compact. Read some reviews that it was hard to figure out but its not. I have my wife's betta, two neon tetras, an otocinclus, and some shrimp in the system. They all seem to be doing well and healthy. Also have anachris and moneywort plants which look well. Only complaint is the pump is loud. Mine is probably defective but I don't want to have to break it down to replace the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Yri

customer_reviews.title: Looks really really cool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks REALLY cool, my beta fish loves it, he's swimming all around; he can't believe how big and cool his new house is ! The glass is solid, easy set up (and I suck at directions and set ups) , looks sleek and modern and cool. Can't wait to show friends
customer_reviews.author: michelle l colucci

customer_reviews.title: Really cool tank!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the tank, fairly easy to set up. Perfect for my betta he loves it. The filter is quiet I don’t even hear it and the led light is a touch button, would definitely buy this again, worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: I love this tank for my Betta
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank for my Betta. Very quiet pump. Just aim the valve towards the glass and it won't interrupt the fish or create a strong current.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE that they are "real glass" Really cant get better ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself 2 and 1 as gift. I LOVE that they are "real glass" Really cant get better for $$$ The "Chain" Pet Stores more expensive!! These were packed REALLY well. I LOVE!!! BTW: Do NOT put more than 3 or 4 guppies and 4 shrimp in this aquarium. You just CANT if you want happy environment.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tiny tank for our tiny home
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, very pleased with appearance & function. Fits great into our shipping container tiny home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tank. I have my Beta fish & a few snails in it. I keep it in my office at work, and it''s a perfect size. I love that it's glass. It''s easy to maintain, the filtering system works great & is easy to clean. Love that it has a space for a heater.a little higher price than some, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice. Love the design
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice. Love the design. Big enough....but not too big. We wanted this for our daughter's bedroom...so didn't want a giant tank. We first started with a gallon size fish bowl, but that was too small....plus got very dirty because there was no filter. This is great. Perfect size, and it has stayed clean also.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: High quality aquarium, strong pump
customer_reviews.text: Generous size for betta, hose modified according to other review to weaken jet. Otherwise perfect, high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner aquarium
customer_reviews.text: My wife has held out for the longest time in allowing an aquarium in the house but I convinced her to try a small one out for daughters sake. This is a perfect beginner aquarium. For the time being we have a betta and two African dwarf frogs and they all seem very happy. Per other reviewers suggestions, we have a mini submersible heater in the pump compartment and a bit of sponge tied over the pump outlet to lessen the current in the tank, and this is a perfect arrangement. Pump is extremely quiet to the point that I can barely tell if it's on.
customer_reviews.author: Alastor

product_meta.title: Fluval Spec III Aquarium Kit, 2.6-Gallon
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

Fluval SPEC is a contemporary looking aquarium designed for small areas such as desktops and countertops. This 2.6-gallon etched glass aquarium with aluminum trim combines style and functionality in one small package. Though small in stature, Fluval SPEC is big on features. It comes with a sleekly designed overhanging LED lighting system, consisting of 31 powerful LED lamps, that arches above the aquarium to provide brilliant illumination for plants and décor. The aquarium includes a powerful circulation pump with adjustable output nozzle and a large 3-stage filtration system that provides more than enough filtration for ultra clean and clear water. It also comes with all the necessary filter media for effective and thorough mechanical, chemical and biological filtration: a porous foam block with convenient handle traps large particles and debris, activated carbon adsorbs unwanted odors, discolorations and impurities and BioMax insert provides optimal colonization of beneficial bacteria and enhances the nitrification of fish wastes. The pump and filtration system are conveniently located in a separate chamber at one end of the aquarium to simplify maintenance. To ensure the well-being of aquarium inhabitants, it is essential to maintain your aquarium. At the very minimum, remove 20% of the water once a week and replace with tap water that is of similar temperature to your tank and treated with the correct dose of Nutrafin Aqua Plus. Regular replacement of Fluval filter media is essential to ensure optimum performance. The filter media should be changed alternately in order to maintain continuous biological activity. To enhance bacterial action, pour a dose of Nutrafin Cycle onto your filter inserts each time you change the media.
feature_bullets: 2.6-gallon etched glass aquarium with aluminum trim
High-output 7000K LED with all-aluminum, waterproof casing for enhanced plant growth and fish colors
Powerful 3-stage filtration for superior water quality and stylish honeycomb wrap to conceal rear filtration compartment
Includes glass aquarium with cover; LED lighting system; safe, low-voltage transformer; circulation pump with output nozzle; foam filter block with handle; activated carbon insert; and BioMax insert

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
